intro: Centropogon cinnabarinus, commonly known as the scarlet flame or red flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking red-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Centropogon cinnabarinus thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
